properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 1 at 2:27PM MST until February 4 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
A storm system will move through the central Rockies from late
Sunday through the early part of the week. Expect increasing
areas of snow Sunday night and Monday. Snow amounts in excess of 6
inches will be possible in portions of northeast Wyoming to the
higher Black Hills. At this time, the highest snow totals are
expected in southern Campbell County and the northern Black Hills.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 11
inches.

* WHERE...Southern Campbell County.

* WHEN...From 8 PM Sunday to midnight MST Monday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Patchy blowing snow
could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions
could impact the morning or evening commute.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather
conditions are expected. This will create dangerous conditions.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM SUNDAY TO MIDNIGHT MST MONDAY NIGHT
